DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Detection Clinical Or Hematologic Finding Method Disease Marker Laboratory Procedure Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Detection Clinical Or Hematologic Finding Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: .11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was the disease detected by c
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the disease detected by clinical or hematologic evidence?

DataElement.changeDescription: .11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed.
